title: [Refactor] - Introducing test coverage with new command and adding some new unit tests
body:
Thank you for your contribution to the ClintonCAT repo.
Before submitting this PR, please make sure:

- [x] The target of this PR is the `main` branch.
- [x] No commits are missing from forked base branch (e.g. modified main branch instead of dev)
- [x] All test pass, run `npm test`
- [x] The code is formated, run `npm run format`

### Changes
- Adding a new command which will force jest to run in `coverage` mode so that devs can see what areas are lacking test coverage.
- Ignoring the generated coverage dir, adding some new tests.
- `npm run test` will remain unaffected. The new command `npm run test:coverage` can be used by devs locally.
- Renaming `utils.types.ts` to just `types.ts`. This file is ignored when generating a coverage report.
author: barrymun

comments.body: Great! thank you very much.

title: [Refactor] - Pre-commit hooks
body:
Thank you for your contribution to the ClintonCAT repo.
Before submitting this PR, please make sure:

- [x] The target of this PR is the `main` branch.
- [x] No commits are missing from forked base branch (e.g. modified main branch instead of dev)

### Changes
- Install `husky` pre-commit hooks so linting and tests are executed before any changes are committed (any other commits to be executed pre-commit can be added to the `.husky/pre-commit` file).
- Adding prettier to the eslint config so linting will pick up prettier errors and prettier errors will be shown in the IDE/editor.
- Change prettier line endings to auto to cater for windows and mac devs.
author: barrymun

comments.body:
please can you yank the pages_db*.json files, they are autogenerated so I'll fix the the generation script. 
Thank you

I added a couple suggested code changes:
- adding npm run typecheck to package.json and git hook
- excluding `.idea` from prettier

> please can you yank the pages_db*.json files, they are autogenerated so I'll fix the the generation script. Thank you

These changes have been reverted, and the `data` directory is ignored when running `format`.

> I added a couple suggested code changes:
> 
> * adding npm run typecheck to package.json and git hook
> * excluding `.idea` from prettier

Thanks, I've implemented these changes. Let me know if you see any other problems.
thanks for your time on this.

title: [Fix] - producing false positives in results fuzzy search
body:
## What
- Refines the fuzzy search logic in PagesDB to reduce false positives and add ranking. 
- Added tests

## Changes & Notes

**Word-Boundary Matching**
- Ensures “repair” doesn't match “repairs,” “repairable,” or “repaired,” preventing unwanted partial matches.


**matchAllWords Refinement**
- Maintains the existing parameter but improves how it’s applied alongside boundary matching.
- Users can still require all words or allow any single matching word.


**Result Ranking**
- Introduces a ranking mechanism by counting matched words and sorting the results in descending order of relevance.
- Entries are sorted by how many query words they match, surfacing stronger matches first.

## Tests
- Added tests (`database.test.ts`) covering single-word, multi-word, and sorting scenarios
- Restructured the test file by adding `describes` for different parts of `database.ts`

------ 

- [x] The target of this PR is the `main` branch.
- [x] No commits are missing from forked base branch (e.g. modified main branch instead of dev)
author: Producdevity

comments.body:
Please can you do a `npm run format` and update the PR.
The main thing is that the `listener.js` file in this PR has CRLF line endings.
Thank you.

> Please can you do a `npm run format` and update the PR. The main thing is that the `listener.js` file in this PR has CRLF line endings. Thank you.

I made sure to do `npm run format`, but only `domhelper.ts` changed

The formatting changes to that file should be addressed in #53 as `"endOfLine": "auto"` is added to the prettier config in that PR. I think this is a result of some devs using windows and others using linux/mac.

> The formatting changes to that file should be addressed in #53 as `"endOfLine": "auto"` is added to the prettier config in that PR. I think this is a result of some devs using windows and others using linux/mac.

Makes sense, I have been switching back and forth while working on this too. I'll make sure to pull your changes (#53) when it gets merged and update my PR with correctly formatted files
thanks for your time on this.

title: Avoid repeated pref init
body: Sorry for the immediate follow up, but `Preferences.init()` was called in the wrong place and the options page was broken.
author: Edgiest05

comments.body: no problem, thanks again.
I noticed it wasn't behaving, and the list of domains still doesn't save (or maybe load, not looked), I'd had assumed that it was because I'd left a load of TODO's
I can't say for sure that the preferences are being saved (haven't checked), but from what I can see they are definitely not loaded on options page loading

title: feat: Implemented ValueListeners for preferences
body:
With this PR I'm proposing a different way to handle user `Preferences`, in hope to react more easily to their modifications.

Whenever working with them one should call the `Preferences.init()` method to initialize the underling logic that ties the class with the actual localStorage access. Afterwards the developer is free to create custom callbacks that are called whenever the value that such listeners hold changes in any way (do not use the actual value's methods, otherwise callbacks won't fire, use only those defined in the Listener class).
When adding callbacks using `addListener` a string-id is required to recognize different callbacks and to remove them if needed.

Furthermore, excluded domains are now automatically sorted.

I'm open to any feedback, thanks again for your time.
author: Edgiest05

comments.body: thank you very much for this

title: Feature - Support for the gecko browser engine (and potentially other engines in the future) with a generalised config
body:
Thank you for your contribution to the ClintonCAT repo.
Before submitting this PR, please make sure:

- [x] The target of this PR is the `main` branch.
- [x] No commits are missing from forked base branch (e.g. modified main branch instead of dev)

### Changes
- Addresses #31.
- Support for the gecko engine (firefox browser).
- Split the `webpack` config so that other engines can more easily be supported.
- Account for differences in manifest.json files.

Cannot fully test the extension as there are many features that are still a WIP, but I'm hoping that these changes will help wrt the generalisation of the config.

### Usage
When building, run `npm run build:chromium` when building for chrome (or other chromium-based browsers), and run `npm run build:gecko` when building for firefox.

Please let me know if any issues are spotted. Thanks.
author: barrymun

comments.body: thank you very much this!

title: automatic background updates
body:
Partially solving #25

- Adds alarms permissions
- Removes scripts entry to prevent double execution
- Add logic to periodically update the cached pagesDb via the chrome.storage.local api

- [ ] Needs testing in firefox

But, please could you re-raise this PR against the `dev` branch, for now*, thanks.      

*I'll probably switch to the more expected flow of raising PR's against main soon, the PR template will reflect this.

title: Force PR template and typo fix
body:
Changed the behavior of the PR template to not require query parameters and, instead, be auto-filled regardless.
Also fixed a typo.

Thanks again for your willingness to bring this extension to life! :rocket:

title: Allow customization of BASE_URL
body:
I'd like to be able to point this extension at a local mirror, without having to edit background.js

Partially addresses #16
author: Pandapip1

comments.body: This is a POC and the search mechanism will change, please see updates to #16
This is still a separate request, as the cache will still need to be periodically refetched and I would like to be able to customize its URL.

title: UI design suggestions
body: Probably a useful way might be to have an icon based on if there are known anti-consumer practices for the current site. A click of it could then simply give a summary of any issues. This will need to be developed over time based on how the mods decide to standardise pages.
author: mingyee2

comments.body: thanks for the suggestion, similar in concept to #10

title: Added setting manager via localstorage, option to open in a new tab, …
body:
Sorry I'm a little late as there was 8 commits ahead of me (1 conflicting) by the time this is ready, but basically I added a full SettingsManager. You can switch it to sync storage if you prefer that (as I see it was use for white listing) to local storage as I used.

I adapted the entire extension to be compatible with ESM, so you could use node.js/npm modules.

I added the option to choose between displaying a banner or open in a new tab.
author: FMaz008

comments.body:
I tried to resolve the merge conflict. Pretty sure the management of white listing will have to be refactored, but I tried not to touch it. 

The manifest has a duplicate entry for background.js, I understand this is for compatibility with Firefox, however you will probably need to have 3 manifest.json files:
one for testing, with both entries, which will create an error for the browser not being in use.
One for chrome, without the script entry
One for firefox, without the service_worker entry.

Note that I accidentally removed the script entry in my conflict resolution, you might want to re-add it.
Thanks for this I should get a chance to look at this in a day or so.
please could you resubmit this PR against the `dev` branch, thanks.
Project is now implemented in TypeScript and React

title: Introduced issue and PR templates
body:
I hope these templates (when merged in the default branch) will help you manage this repo.
The PR template explicitly warns contributors to target the ~dev branch~ and to make changes from there so that you can accept them directly.
Lastly I've added a bare-bones CODE_OF_CONDUCT.

Thanks for your time on this!
author: Edgiest05

comments.body: Thank you very much for this!
